Ok. So I´ve played the game for a bit now. I have a few complaints about the game. I dont know if its the game itself or my comp.

1. When I saw the first film scene I thought: "Hmm it´s kinda glitchy. This took most of the fun out of the game.

2. After a while I noticed the sound from my gun had dissappeard.

3. I´ve tried to find the "jump for a crate to protect my self or from an enemy" but i cant find it.

4. There are not alot of options in this game. By options I mean. Fast jump from one wall to another or command the others.

5. It was booring and not scary at all...

6. Is this really a resident evil game? What happened?

@Morphesto
1. I didn't see any glitches in the first film scene, so I don't know what could be causing them.
2. Yea, that happens from time to time, but in my case it just gets muffeled, it doesn't dissapear completely. Although it does if you're playing it first time, it stops doing that after some time you've spent in the game.
3. Try using Shift+E while running towards a box. Your character is gonna throw himself to the ground, providing you cover via the object you were running towards to, and then when he gets up, he's automatically gonna take cover(if i understood your question correctly).
4. Yea, I noticed that you can't command others and that bothered me since the AI in the game is pretty bad because they're relying on the fact that the game is too fun to be played solo, and so it is. I'm just waiting for a PC release, since we always get everying a little later. 
5. Well it wasn't scary, because of the fact that you're not playing it alone. Some of the parts of the game can't be done without friends or bots, even if they are just sitting ducks :) Anyways this wasn't supposed to have much horror in it, but heavy multiplayer action. 
6. Well i liked this game, and i'm still playing it, because it fills the story of Resident Evil 2 and 3 quite nicely. I just think that Capcom released this before re6 to get the hype up, or for people to have some fun before they finish so they don't feel rushed and fuck it up, since it's probably gonna be the last part of it. Any more parts would be overusing it I think.

Note: To those having the black screen problem i had this problem when i didn't have WLIDSVCM.exe google that with raccoon city or w.e and find a download that will repair your windows live ID service manager its for logging in to certain games that use windows live as an anti-piracy measure i remember battlestations pacific used it and i bought it from steam so i tried running it and had the same problem with that game too so most likely thats your guys problem with the black crash and Game has stopped working or responding etc.
